---
title: "redis-ca-path.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file defines settings for a cache system using Redis as the backend. It specifies cache enablement, backend type, Time-To-Live (TTL), and the path to a CA certificate for Redis connection.

## Symbols

### `cache`
#### Description
The root configuration object for the cache system.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables the cache system
- Specifies Redis as the backend
- Sets a TTL of 60 seconds
- Configures Redis-specific settings

### `cache.enabled`
#### Description
A boolean flag to enable or disable the cache system.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | Determines if the cache is active |

### `cache.backend`
#### Description
Specifies the type of cache backend to be used.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| backend | string | The cache backend type (set to "redis") |

### `cache.ttl`
#### Description
Defines the Time-To-Live for cached items.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| ttl | duration | The duration for which cached items remain valid (set to 60 seconds) |

### `cache.redis`
#### Description
Configuration object for Redis-specific settings.

### `cache.redis.ca_cert_path`
#### Description
Specifies the file path to the CA certificate for secure Redis connections.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| ca_cert_path | string | The file path to the CA certificate (set to "internal/config/testdata/ca.pem") |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| cache.enabled | boolean | true | Enables or disables the cache system |
| cache.backend | string | "redis" | Specifies the cache backend type |
| cache.ttl | duration | "60s" | Sets the Time-To-Live for cached items |
| cache.redis.ca_cert_path | string | "internal/config/testdata/ca.pem" | Path to the CA certificate for Redis connections |

This configuration file is likely part of a larger system that uses caching with Redis as the backend. The file specifies that the cache is enabled, uses Redis, and sets a relatively short TTL of 60 seconds. It also provides a path to a CA certificate, suggesting that secure connections to Redis are supported or required. The location of the configuration file (in a "testdata" directory) implies that it might be used for testing purposes.
